summary: Introduced in the House of Representatives, this bill (H.R. 397) seeks to honor Minister Franklin Florence by renaming a United States Postal Service facility. It proposes to designate the post office located at 216 Cumberland Street in Rochester, New York, as the “Minister Franklin Florence Memorial Post Office”. The legislation specifies that all official references in laws, documents, maps, and other records shall use this new name for the facility. This is a commemorative bill recognizing a local community figure.
